mrbayes 0.1.0
  • Reference

Bayesian implementation of the MR-Egger model with choice of prior distributions using JAGS.

mr_egger_rjags.Rd

Bayesian implementation of the MR-Egger model with choice of prior distributions using JAGS.

mr_egger_rjags(object, methods = "default", betaprior = "",
  sigmaprior = "", n.chains = 1, n.burn = 1000, n.iter = 5000,
  seed = NULL, ...)

Arguments

object

The data frame converted into the format_mr format
methods

The values are used to identify the proposed priors default indicates non-informative prior weak indicates weakly informative prior pseudo indicates pseudo-horseshoe prior.
betaprior

This is an option for setting a prior for the causal estimate.
sigmaprior

This is an option for setting a prior for the inflating parameter in the MR-Egger model.
n.chains

This is an option for choosing the number of chains for MCMC simulation, default number is 3 chains.
n.burn

This is the option for the burn in period of the bayesian MCMC runs. The default option is 1000 samples
n.iter

This is the option for the number of bayesian MCMC runs. The default is 5000 iterations
seed

This is an option for setting seeds for reproducible results. The default is NULL
...

Passing options through to rjags::jags.model()

Value

The result object of class eggerjags contains the following components:

AvgPleio

The mean of the generated pleiotropic effect

CausalEffect

The mean of the generated causal effects

StandardError

Standard deviation of the mean causal effect

psi

The value of the inflating parameter based on the priors

CredibleInterval

The credible interval for the causal effect, which indicates the lower(2.5%), median (50%) and upper intervals (97.5%)

samples

Output of the bayesian MCMC samples with the different chains

method

The specified prior

References

Bowden et. al., Mendelian randomization with invalid instruments: effect estimation and bias detection through Egger regression. International Journal of Epidemiology 2015. 44(2): p. 512-525. https://doi.org/10.1093/ije/dyv080

Examples

data(bmi_insulin)
fit <- mr_egger_rjags(bmi_insulin, n.chains = 1)
#> Compiling model graph
#>    Resolving undeclared variables
#>    Allocating nodes
#> Graph information:
#>    Observed stochastic nodes: 14
#>    Unobserved stochastic nodes: 3
#>    Total graph size: 96
#> 
#> Initializing model
#> 
summary(fit)
#> Prior : 
#> 
#>  Pleiotropy ~ dnorm(0, 1E-3) 
#>  Estimate ~ dnorm(0, 1E-3) 
#>  psi ~ dunif(.0001, 10) 
#> 
#> Estimation results: 
#>  
#>  MCMC iterations = 6000 
#>  Burn in = 1000 
#>  Sample size by chain = 5000 
#>  Number of Chains = 1 
#>  Number of SNPs = 14 
#>  
#> Inflating Parameter: 7.646619 
#> 
#>                  Estimate         SD       2.5%         50%      97.5%
#> Avg Pleio     -0.05235919 0.03662472 -0.1255990 -0.05198841 0.01950798
#> Causal Effect  3.64115224 2.16993383 -0.6159704  3.60541912 7.95695656
plot(fit$samples)
